text: oftentimes you know i think those of us
that are sort of experienced with the
language sort of uh typically
um settle on this sort of rule of three
um kind of thing uh for me personally i
don't consider something reusable unless
i've actually reused it meaning that i
don't try to sort of preempt the process
of
sort of prematurely you know try trying
to make something unreasonable even if i
have a hunch that it is going to be
reusable right sort of piggyback off of
the the suggesters um
sort of explanation of like utility
functions and things like that like
contains whatever it is these things
don't have on their face seems like yeah
that that should be a reusable thing but
for me like
until i've seen something at least three
times i don't have enough data to
understand all the edge cases to
understand
the variety of ways a particular
piece of functionality or even
a domain within my application within my
ecosystem how that's going to be reused
so i don't consider anything sort of
reusable unless i've actually reused it
a few times
yeah and what are your thoughts on that
yeah i mean i definitely agree with that
kind of rule of three idea um
i would much rather copy and paste code
multiple times than like try to make a

like it's so much easier to
like add an abstraction later than it is
to take one away so i'd much rather just

you have to
